summary: DOD aims to provide behavioral health care to active-duty service members at its military treatment facilities, but it has also needed to make referrals to civilian providers to meet demand. DOD generally monitors the timeliness of appointments, and is working to fill provider vacancies at its facilities. But it hasn't monitored how long it takes to get appointments with civilian providers after an urgent referral...
title: Defense Health Care: DOD Should Monitor Urgent Referrals to Civilian Behavioral Health Providers to Ensure Timely Care
